revised_title: Discovery of Two Iodide Salts of Tin
tldr: Thomas H. Henry conducted experiments to clarify the properties of tin and iodine compounds. He discovered that the substance obtained by heating tin with twice its weight of iodine is a mixture of two salts: a soluble proto-iodide and an insoluble biniodide. Henry also found that the biniodide sublimes at 356°F, while the proto-iodide can be heated to redness without subliming.
